intro: Spermacoce ramosa, commonly known as the hairy false dandelion, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that are clustered in cymes, followed by distinctive, three-lobed berries. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forests or along stream banks. Spermacoce ramosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some cultures.
